slides.ocrText: Creating Activities

Lesson
objectives

¢ Create and configure activity patterns
* Create and configure activities
Activity overview

| Activity

¢ An activity represents a task that someone
must attend to or an issue that someone should
be aware of

¢ Used to:
* Let automatic processes assign work to user
¢ Let a user assign work to another user

¢ Alert user to certain event, such as an underwriting
issue

a Ss

slides.originalNotes:
Activity parent objects 
An activity bubbles up from a job to the associated policy and then the associated account. For example7 if you create an activity on a Policy Change
job, you will see the activity listed at the policy level and the account level.
slides.notes:
Activity parent objects 
An activity bubbles up from a job to the associated policy and then the associated account. For example7 if you create an activity on a Policy Change
job, you will see the activity listed at the policy level and the account level.
slides.ocrText:
| Activity parent objects G

¢ Every activity is associated with an account

* Can also be associated with a job (and its subtypes) or a policy, which implicitly
links it to their account, which implicitly links it to their account

lm Account [a a
ve GS Co) Policy

slides.originalNotes:
When are activities created?
An activity can also be created from a Workflow step. For example, an activity step creates one or more blocking activities and suspends execution of the workflow.

Activity pattern

slides.originalNotes:
Activity patterns
Users with administrative permissions have the ability to create and modify activity patterns on the Administration tab.

Configuration users can configure the data model to add fields to the activity pattern entity. When a field is added to the activity pattern entity, it is available on all activity patterns- For example, a given carrier might want to add a "Required Role" field which is used to identify the role a person must have in order to have this type of activity assigned to them-
slides.notes:
Activity patterns
Users with administrative permissions have the ability to create and modify activity patterns on the Administration tab.

Configuration users can configure the data model to add fields to the activity pattern entity. When a field is added to the activity pattern entity, it is available on all activity patterns- For example, a given carrier might want to add a "Required Role" field which is used to identify the role a person must have in order to have this type of activity assigned to them-
slides.ocrText:
| Activity patterns G

¢ Activity patterns are templates that standardize how activities are generated

¢ Both the user interface and Gosu code create activities based on these patterns

Activity pattern Activity

ea,
Subject = Rate Policy Subject: Rate Policy
Priority = medium Priority: medium
Due Days = 5 Due Date: May 12

Escalation Days = 10 Escalation Date: May 17

slides.originalNotes:
Managing activity patterns
Each pattern describes one kind of activity that might beneeded in handling the policy or account process. Activity patterns contain many default, or typical, characteristics for each activity, such as its name, its relative priority, and whether or not it is mandatory. The Code field is a unique internal name for the pattern- System will throw Duplicate key in Activity Pattern error if code is not unique. Business rules and Gosu use this code when creating an activity or checking to see which pattern an activity was created from. 

Activity pattern fields are explained in detailed in the Application Guide.
slides.notes:
Managing activity patterns
Each pattern describes one kind of activity that might beneeded in handling the policy or account process. Activity patterns contain many default, or typical, characteristics for each activity, such as its name, its relative priority, and whether or not it is mandatory. The Code field is a unique internal name for the pattern- System will throw Duplicate key in Activity Pattern error if code is not unique. Business rules and Gosu use this code when creating an activity or checking to see which pattern an activity was created from. 

Activity pattern fields are explained in detailed in the Application Guide.
slides.ocrText:
i Managing activity patterns G&G

¢ Activity patterns are typically created and modified by administrators
¢ Administration tab > Business Settings > Activity Patterns
¢ To create a new activity pattern, click the New Activity Pattern button

* Code field is a unique internal name for the pattern and is used to reference an activity pattern
in Gosu

¢ To edit an existing activity pattern, click the name of the activity pattern in the list

* Changes to an activity pattern affect only activities from that point forward

slides.originalNotes:
Using activity pattems in Gosu
The pattern_code field of an vactivity pattern is unique and is used to identify and retrieve the activity patterm
slides.notes:
Using activity pattems in Gosu
The pattern_code field of an vactivity pattern is unique and is used to identify and retrieve the activity patterm
slides.ocrText:
i Using activity patterns in Gosu G&G

¢ There are two operations that you can perform in Gosu involving activity patterns

* One is to test which activity pattern an existing activity uses
+ Entity.ActivityPattern.Code == “pattern_code”

* The other is to retrieve an activity pattern for use in creating a new activity
* ActivityPattern.finder.getActivityPatternByCode( “pattern_code” )

« Returns an ActivityPattern object

¢ Use the activity pattern code to refer to an activity pattern in Gosu code

* Do not use a pattern ID or PublicID value

slides.originalNotes:
Create activity related to an account
This method sets the specified fields and returns the created  activity- The field descriptions are:
Bundle — (Bundle) bundle in which to create the activity
Account— (Account) account to which the activity is related.
Subject — (String) subject of the activity
Description — (String) description of the activity_
Approval Issue — (String) reason approval is needed.
This field should only be set for approval activities.
Priority — (typekey Priority) priority of the activity with respect to other activities.
Mandatory — (Boolean) True if the activity must be completed and can’t be skipped.
Target Date — (Date) date by which a person should complete the task.
Escalation Date — (Date) When the activity will be escalated if it isn't yet completed

Bundle. To manage database transactions, Guidewire applications group entity instances in groups called bundles- A bundle is a collection of in-memory entity instances that represent rows in the database- The application transmits and saves all entity instances in the bundle to the databasein one transaction. A bundle includes changed entities, new entities, and entities to delete from the database- Gosu represents a bundle with the class gw.transaction. Bun dle.

In Policy Center, the application creates a bundle when a policy transaction is executed- Therefore, if you reference Gosu code from a policy transaction, it is not necessary to create bundle explicitly

A bundle includes changed entities, new entities, and entities to delete from the database- Gosu represents a bundle with the class gw.transaction. Bun dle.

slides.ocrText:
i Create activity related to an account Gi

* Gosu code

activityPattern.createAccountActivity(bundle, activityPattern, Account, subject, description,
approvallssue, priority, mandatory, targetDate, escalationDat¢
or

account.newActivity(activityPattern)

* Example

var anAccount : Account
var anActivityPattern : ActivityPattern

anActivityPattern = ActivityPattern.finder.getActivityPatternByCode ("notification")
anAccount.newActivity (anActivityPattern)

slides.originalNotes:
Create activity related to a policy
This method sets the specified fields and returns the created activity- The field descriptions are:
Bundle — (Bundle) bundle in which to create the activity 
Policy— (Policy) policy to which the activity is related.
Subject — (String) subject of the activity
Description — (String) description of the activity 
Approval Issue — (String) reason approval is needed. This field should only be set for approval activities.
Priority — (type key Priority) priority of the activity with respect to other activities.
Mandatory — (Boolean) True if the activity must be completed and can’t be skipped.
Target Date — (Date) date by which a person should complete the task. Escalation Date — (Date) When the activity will be escalated if it isn't yet completed

Bundle. To manage database transactions, Guidewire applications group entity instances in groups called bundles- A bundle is a collection of in-memory entity instances that represent rows in the database- The application transmits and saves all entity instances in the bundle to the database in one transaction. A bundle includes changed entities, new entities, and entities to delete from the database- Gosu represents a bundle with the class gw.transaction.Bundle.

In Policy Center, the application creates abundle when a policy transaction is executed- Therefore, if you reference Gosu code from a policy transaction, it is not necessary to create a bundle explicitly

i Create activity related to a policy Gi

* Gosu code

activityPattern.createPolicyActivity(bundle, policy, subject, description, approvallssue,
priority, mandatory, targetDate, escalationDat¢

. Example if (policy != null) {
var a: Activity
var pattern = ActivityPattern. finder.getActivityPatternByCode ("coverage")
@ = pattern.createPolicyActivity(
policy.Bundle,
policy,
"Verify coverage",
"Call customer to verify coverage",
null,
typekey.Priority.TC_NORMAL,
false,
null,
null)

¢ By default, an activity is always related to an account

Subject — (String) subject of the activity
Description — (String) description of the activity-
Approval Issue — (String) reason approval is needed. This field should only be set for approval activities.
Priority — (typekey Priority) priority of the activity with respect to other activities-
Mandatory — (Boolean) True if the activity must be completed and can’t be skipped.
Target Date — (Date) date by which a person should complete the task.
Escalation Date — (Date) When the activity will be escalated if it isn't yet completed

To manage database transactions, Guidewire applications group entity instances in groups called bundles- A bundle is a collection of in-memory entity instances that represent rows in the database- The application transmits and saves all entity instances in the bundle to the database in one transaction. A bundle includes changed entities, new entities, and entities to delete from the database- Gosu represents a bundle with theclass gw.transaction.Bun dle.

In PolicyCenter, the application creates a bundle when a policy transaction is executed- Therefore, if you reference Gosu code from a policy transaction, it is not necessary to create a bundle explicitly
